title: Woody Cook isn’t planning to chase celebrity stardom after The Circle
text:
Woody Cook finished fifth on The Circle (Picture: Peter Powell/PA Wire)

Woody Cook might have become a fan favourite on The Circle, but he isn’t planning to capitalise on his newfound fame.

The 18-year-old student made it to the final of the Channel 4 reality show, losing out to winner Paddy Smyth in the last rating between the remaining contestants.

The last episode also saw Woody reveal his famous parentage, Zoe Ball and Fatboy Slim, to the group – prompting some shocked faces.

Speaking after the finale, Woody isn’t seeking a celebrity career after the show and hopes to return to being a ‘normal’ teenager.

Speaking to PA, Woody said his plan was to: ‘Continue being a normal teenager. I’m just being me.

‘It’s back to normal proceedings rather than trying to chase it up. You’re only young once, and I’d rather be young than try and be famous.’

Woody met the other contestants face to face in the final (Picture: Channel 4)

He’s also planning to go on a gap year, adding he wants to: ‘Go to Australia, go to New Zealand, have a mad one.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Zoe and Fatboy Slim, real name Norman Cook, sent their son a heart-warming message of support during his time in The Circle – which left Woody particularly emotional.

‘Seeing the little video message they sent me, where they said they were wrong. I was very, very chuffed,’ Woody added.

‘I had always told them I’d be alright on my own. They never believed me.

Paddy Smyth took home the players prize (Picture: PA)

‘Hearing they were proud of me was a really sweet moment and it really brought a tear to my eye.’

Speaking to Metro.co.uk, Woody revealed how he’s glad he didn’t bag the £70,000 cash prize.

‘I think I would’ve felt guilty if I won,’ Woody said. ‘Because I feel like there were people who definitely, concerning their situations and everything, I come from a family with a bit of cash, and if I won the cash… it just doesn’t mean as much as to someone else who’s actually worked quite hard to win.

‘There was one bit where I was like, “Oh they schemed against me, I’m gutted”, but then at the same time it was like, “You know what, I never actually properly wanted to win”.’

The Circle is available to watch on Channel 4’s catch-up service 40D.

MORE: The Circle’s Woody admits Zoe Ball and Fatboy Slim were livid he took part after ‘hiding him from spotlight’
description: Woody has revealed how he won't attempt to maintain his fame after The Circle.
